DataElement.preferredName: Incomplete Caries Removal Indirect Pulp Cap Treatment Soft Carious Dentin Tooth 30 Administered Next Decision Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the type of subsequent decision (the process of making a selective intellectual judgment when presented with several complex alternatives consisting of several variables, and usually defining a course of action or an idea) related to soft tooth decay that has invaded the dentin (the porous, yellow-hued material between the enamel and pulp of the tooth) in tooth number 30 (the first, permanent six-year molar of the lower right arch) administered with incomplete removal of decayed tooth and covering of nearly exposed pulp with protect dressing.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Incomplete Caries Removal Indirect Pulp Cap Treatment Soft Carious Dentin Tooth 30 Administered
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to soft tooth decay that has invaded the dentin (the porous, yellow-hued material between the enamel and pulp of the tooth) in tooth number 30 (the first, permanent six-year molar of the lower right arch) administered with incomplete removal of decayed tooth and covering of nearly exposed pulp with protect dressing.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Incomplete Caries Removal Indirect Pulp Cap Therapy
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Not whole; lacking some necessary part or detail; unfinished.:Any process by which decayed tooth material is removed from the tooth.:A procedure in which the nearly exposed pulp is covered with a protective dressing to protect the pulp from additional injury and to promote healing and repair via formation of secondary dentin.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: Not whole; lacking some necessary part or detail; unfinished.
Any process by which decayed tooth material is removed from the tooth.
A procedure in which the nearly exposed pulp is covered with a protective dressing to protect the pulp from additional injury and to promote healing and repair via formation of secondary dentin.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Property.preferredDefinition: Soft; lacking in hardness relatively or comparatively.:Tooth decay that has invaded the dentin, the porous, yellow-hued material between the enamel and pulp of the tooth.:The first, permanent six-year molar of the lower right arch as defined by the Universal tooth numbering system.:Given.

Concepts.definition: Lacking in hardness relatively or comparatively.
Tooth decay that has invaded the dentin, creating dentin that is partially demineralized and containing mineral crystals in the tubules.
The first, permanent, six-year molar of the lower right arch as defined by the Universal tooth numbering system.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the type of subsequent decision (the process of making a selective intellectual judgment when presented with several complex alternatives consisting of several variables, and usually defining a course of action or an idea) for treatment administered.
